chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Dallapiazza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
No use or possession of controlled substances.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with victim, victim's family, residence, school, or employment.
No association with known drug users or places where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without DOC approved supervising chaperone and the prior permission of the agent.

Submit DNA sample and pay costs of. Maintain fulltime employment. No employment of 'cash' jobs.
Comply with Sex Offender Registration and pay any fees.
Sex Offender Treatment, Evaluation, Psychological evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court examines defendant and finds defendant guilty. State recommends a presentence report. At the time of sentencing State will recommend 7 years prison with 5 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision with conditions. Defense will be free to argues sentence.Court orders a presentence report be filed and adjourns sentencing. Defendant remanded to custody.

Defendant has 2 cases 14CF330/14CF331. Defendant Charles J Dallapiazza in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant stated he will have Atty. Mark Tishberg. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing. Court is informed there is a hold on defendant. State recommendation $15,000 cash bail w/condition no contact with victim or J or anyone under 17 years. Court orders $25,000 cash bail on each case totaling $50,000 w/conditions.
